data.question: Which major organ of the body consists of two atria and two ventricles?
Proverbially speaking, the (what) of the pudding is in the eating?
A subsidy program in Australia, PBS stands for what scheme?
Does wind typically blow faster over the land or over the ocean?
Pusillanimous is an apt descriptor for which one of Dorothy’s companions in The Wizard of Oz: Scarecrow, Tin Man or Lion?
The ice-cream marketed as Cookie Crumble in New Zealand goes by what alliterative name in Australia?
Australia’s Oscar Piastri won the Formula 1 Grand Prix held in which country over the weekend?
What have “you really got”, according to the title of a classic Kinks song?
Pivotonians is an old nickname for which football club in the AFL?
Buon fresco is a fresco painting technique in which pigments are applied to wet what?
In the sport of BASE jumping, what does BASE stand for?
Which singers sang I’ll Take You There in 1972?
The bramble wattle and the sulphur-crested cockatoo appear on which Australian banknote?
Emmanuel Agassi, father of tennis great Andre, competed at two Summer Olympics in which sport?
Which European carrier is recognised as the world’s oldest continuously operating airline?
